current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To provide tax relief for persons affected by the
		  discharge of oil in connection with the explosion on, and sinking of, the
		  mobile offshore drilling unit Deepwater Horizon.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Gulf Coast Oil Recovery Zone Tax
			 Relief and Economic Recovery Act

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

For purposes of
			 this Act—

term.#tail:
means the following counties and parishes affected by the Gulf oil
			 spill:

text.#text: The term

The counties of
			 Escambia, Santa Rosa, Okaloosa, Walton, Bay, Gulf, Franklin, and Wakulla in the
			 State of Florida.

The counties of
			 Hancock, Harrison, and Jackson in the State of Mississippi.

The counties of
			 Mobile and Baldwin in the State of Alabama.

The parishes of
			 Orleans, St. Tammany, St. Bernard, Plaquemines, Jefferson, Lafourche,
			 Terrebonne, St. Mary, Iberia, Vermilion, and Cameron in the State of
			 Louisiana.

term.#tail:
means the discharge of oil by reason of the explosion on, and
			 sinking of, the mobile offshore drilling unit Deepwater Horizon.

text.#text: The term

header.#text:
Non-recognition
			 of income from insurance proceeds which are reinvested in the recovery
			 zone

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
,
			 amounts received from any qualified Gulf oil spill payment shall be recognized
			 only to the extent that the amount realized exceeds the qualified investments
			 made by the taxpayer with respect to such qualified Gulf oil spill
			 payment.

text.#text: For purposes of the
For purposes of this section, the term

any proceeds or
			 payments from insurance received in connection with the Gulf oil spill,
			 or

any payment for
			 damages attributable to the Gulf oil spill under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 1002 of the Oil
			 Pollution Act of 1990

text.#text: For purposes of this section—

term.#tail:
means, with
			 respect to any qualified Gulf oil spill payment, the sum of the qualified
			 recovery zone investments which are made by the taxpayer before the date which
			 is 5 years after the later of—

text.#text: The term

the date of the
			 qualified Gulf oil spill payment, or

the date of the
			 enactment of this Act.
The term

section 168 of the Internal Revenue

) for use in the active conduct of a recovery zone trade

text.#text:
amounts paid or
			 incurred for tangible property (to which

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
) in connection
			 with a qualified recovery zone trade or business.

text.#text:
amounts paid or

header.#text:
Qualified
			 recovery zone trade or business

term.#text:
qualified recovery
			 zone trade or business

text.#text: The term

any commercial or
			 charter fishing business operating in the recovery zone, or

any hotel,
			 lodging, recreation, entertainment, or restaurant business located in the
			 recovery zone.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the basis in any qualified investment shall be reduced (but not below
			 zero) by an amount equal to the amount that bears the same ratio to such basis
			 (determined without regard to this subsection) as the amount of qualified Gulf
			 oil spill payments received by the taxpayer bears to the amount of qualified
			 investments made by the taxpayer with respect to such qualified Gulf oil spill
			 payments.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 1016 of the Internal Revenue Code
			 of 1986

text.#text: For purposes of

This Act shall apply with respect to amounts received from
			 any qualified Gulf oil spill payment and qualified investments made in taxable
			 years ending after April 20, 2010.
